description.text:
Software Development Engineer ( he / she / they ) Please apply only if you are fully bilingual in French and English
Be part of an exciting company that identifies high potential individuals and develops them into professional technology consultants working with the hottest technologies in some of Canada’s top companies - be part of Jarvis Consulting Group’s Technical Training Program! At Jarvis, we recognize that entering the workforce as a new grad or transitioning into a new career is a challenging task, and that's why we are committed to providing opportunities with industry-leading clients, and getting you ready to enter the workforce with confidence.

About the Opportunity
3-months of cost-free comprehensive training and projects led by industry experts:Linux, SQL, GIT, SDLC, Design patternsJava & Springboot, Microservice, REST APICloud Computing and DevOpsData Analytics with SQL and PythonBig Data with Hadoop, Spark, Scala, etc.The opportunity to drastically improve your skills by working with Tech Leads and Professionals while writing more than 15k lines of code in Java, Python, Scala, SQL, etc.Guaranteed two-year placement upon successful completion of the program.The chance to improve your soft skills to unlock new potential, confidence, and leadership.Dedicated support to help you develop your career throughout the program and beyond including, coaching, professional networking opportunities and attaining industry-recognized certificationsA competitive compensation package with support for continuous learning

Once you successfully complete the Technical Consulting Program led by leading industry professionals, you will be guaranteed a two-year placement with one of our prominent clients and some of Canada's top companies!

About you
Diploma or degree in computer science, technology, engineering, or a mathematical discipline (STEM)Proficient with Java or another object oriented programming language ( e.g. C/C++/C#, Python, Golang, Ruby, JavaScript, etc)Familiar with with RDBMS or No-SQL databasesHave completed at least one course (online or school) related to designing algorithms and data structuresNice-to-have: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Could, Linux, DevOps, JavaScript/Angular/React/Vue, Data ScienceLegally permitted to work in Canada (citizen/permanent resident/work permit)   
Next steps
We wanted to make it as simple as possible to apply to our Job Ad through our simple Form and make our interview process short but effective. Our interviewing process includes an Introductory Interview whose purpose is to get some basic information about your skills, qualifications, and interest in the position and also the Technical Evaluation which is an interview to assess your technical ability for the role and the depth and breadth of your knowledge in your chosen field. For more information, please visit our website and read more about our interviewing process here ( https://jrvs.ca/jarvis-hiring-process-what-to-expect/)

smartSnippets: What we are looking for in you. Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team ...

companyDescription.text:
We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely and more cost effectively than any other company.

We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others'. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation.

Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers.

Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why its the fastest growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

If you're interested in a career at Canonical, we are a remote-first company so please apply to any suitable role as skills are valued more than location, despite some having a preferred geographic preference. 

www.ubuntu.com

description.text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.
We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.
If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.
The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical
Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.
In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.
Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.
What your day will look like
Utilise advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisationFocus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomesTell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualisations and presentationsDesign and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote workCollaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace
What we are looking for in you
An exceptional academic track record with a BA/BSc or Masters degree in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineeringFirst work experience in People Analytics Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)Ability to translate business questions to key research objectivesAbility to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findingsExcellent writing and communication skillsWillingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
🏠 Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
📚 Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
💰 Annual compensation review
🏆 Recognition rewards
🏝 Annual holiday leave
👶 Parental Leave
🧑‍💼 Employee Assistance Programme
🧳 Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
✈️ Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

description.text:
JOB TITLE: KDB+/Q Quant DeveloperCLIENT: Prestigious Quantitative Hedge FundSALARY: $CAD 280,000 Total CompensationLOCATION: Toronto
JOB OVERVIEW 
As a KDB+/Q Quant Trading Developer you will develop, hands on, a next generation research and analytics trading platform for the one of the largest and most successful Quant Funds in the world!You will work on large-scale financial data problems in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment, in direct collaboration with Quantitative Researchers and Portfolio Managers where, the solutions you create benefit the entire organization!
PERKS Ownership of mission-critical greenfield projects.Innovative, state-of-the-art technology and software.Intellectually stimulating atmosphere with like-minded people, tackling the toughest problems in the industry.Beautiful offices with video games, board games, foosball, nap areas and table tennis.Flat structure – every members’ input is needed, and encouraged, regardless of seniority.No red tape or endless climbing of corporate ladders.
SKILLS/EXPERIENCE NEEDED: A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.Experience in engineering relevant solutions using KDB+/Q on systems of considerable scale and complexity.Exposure to electronic trading systems or real-time financial data management and analytics.Previous collaboration with quantitative researchers or traders to understand their needs and design and engineer solutions.
NICE TO HAVE A passion for technology and an appreciation that it is always changing.An interest in working with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do
HOW TO APPLY ‘LinkedIn Easy Apply’ with your most updated resume ASAP.

smartSnippets: What we are looking for in you. Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team ...

companyDescription.text:
We deliver open source to the world faster, more securely and more cost effectively than any other company.

We develop Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000 contributors. Ubuntu means 'humanity to others'. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation.

Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers.

Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - Ubuntu is the future of open source, which is why its the fastest growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

If you're interested in a career at Canonical, we are a remote-first company so please apply to any suitable role as skills are valued more than location, despite some having a preferred geographic preference. 

www.ubuntu.com

description.text:
Bring your people analytics, social science research and data mining/science skills to a unique team seeking to understand, and shape, the future of the digital workplace. We are interested in technology, of course, but we are also interested in the human mission of enabling the world's brightest and hardest working people to live where they want and work from anywhere. Most of our colleagues could move to a tech hub but they choose Canonical because of our mission and our approach to the workplace.
We'd like to understand what really makes a distributed, remote-first workplace work. We think we're pretty good at this (being remote first for almost 20 years), but we know there is a lot still to understand, and the frontier of possibility continues to move outward. We'd like to invest in research, analytics and tooling which raises the bar even further for remote collaboration and organisation.
If we are able to build tools that meaningfully improve our cooperation and our satisfaction, then we intend to share our insights with the world, both as a narrative and as SAAS or open source that helps other companies follow in our footsteps.
The role of a Workplace Analytics Engineer at Canonical
Support analytics and data mining in a cross-disciplinary team of organisational psychologists, web front end engineers, back end engineers and statistics / analytics experts to help us build a new definition for the 21st century digital workplace. Collaborate to figure out what really drives productivity, effectiveness and happiness in a remote-first globally distributed company.
In addition to your existing people analytics work experience, this role will combine your skills in psychology, data analytics and visualisation, to help create a more effective workplace.
Location: This role will be based remotely in the AMER region. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the United States, as we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this job opening.
What your day will look like
Utilise advanced data analytics to understand how we hire and how we work (productivity, happiness and effectiveness) across a global, remote first organisationFocus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomesTell the story from the insights through dashboards, visualisations and presentationsDesign and conduct research into trends shaping talent science and remote workCollaborate with stakeholder teams (ex., engineering, information systems, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem supporting our digital workplace
What we are looking for in you
An exceptional academic track record with a BA/BSc or Masters degree in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineeringFirst work experience in People Analytics Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, R, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, etc)Ability to translate business questions to key research objectivesAbility to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findingsExcellent writing and communication skillsWillingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
🏠 Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
📚 Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
💰 Annual compensation review
🏆 Recognition rewards
🏝 Annual holiday leave
👶 Parental Leave
🧑‍💼 Employee Assistance Programme
🧳 Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
✈️ Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

description.text:
The Opportunity:
Our client in BC is looking for a Control Systems Engineer to join their team. In this role you will take on the exciting challenge of developing and maintaining control systems for vehicle safety applications. This role offers the opportunity to work with both model-based and hand code techniques to create embedded control software. As a Control Systems Engineer, you will have the chance to provide technical leadership, assist in training less experienced engineers, and make independent judgments and decisions.
What You'll Be Doing:
Develop and maintain control systems for mobile applicationsCreate control strategies for transmissions and related mobile applicationsGenerate control software from control modelsDevelop and test embedded C code for controllersDesign electrical circuits and subsystems for mobile applicationsSource, test, and evaluate electrical/electro-hydraulic partsDesign and integrate control systems with mechanical componentsOversee assembly and testing of prototype control systemsProvide field commissioning, troubleshooting, and customer supportManage multiple projects and coordinate with internal departmentsUtilize company's engineering standards and ERP/PLM systemsDemonstrate initiative, creativity, and problem-solving skills

What You'll Need To Be Successful:
Proficiency in C programming for embedded systemsExperience with MATLAB/Simulink for model-based developmentStrong mechanical aptitude and understanding of codesFamiliarity with hydraulic, electrical, and control systemsAttention to detail and high level of accuracyExcellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skillsProven organizational and technical writing skillsAbility to work collaboratively and independentlySolid experience with MS Office productsAbility to travel and work on emergencies if neededDesire to learn, develop, and improve work processesExperience in vehicle control system developmentKnowledge of ERP systems and DFMABachelor's degree in engineering or engineering technology diploma requiredManufacturing environment experience desirableClearance Requirement: Must pass controls good clearance (permanent resident or Canadian citizen)Experience in autonomous vehicle projects is an asset.

smartSnippets: We are seeking a talented and experienced BMS Software Test System Automation and Simulation Engineer to join our automotive team. This ...

companyDescription.text: Doing something different is never easy. It requires courage, optimism and grit. Core to our mission is building a team of adventurous individuals determined to make a positive impact on the world. This means challenging ourselves constantly. Stretching beyond the bounds of conventional thinking. Reframing old problems. Seeking new solutions. And operating comfortably in a space of uncertainty. While our backgrounds are diverse, our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations. Do you like doing the impossible? We’d love to hear from you.

description.text:
About Rivian

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

Role Summary

We are seeking a talented and experienced BMS Software Test System Automation and Simulation Engineer to join our automotive team. In this role, you will be responsible for the seamless integration of the Battery Management System (BMS) software with the SIL (Software-In-the-Loop) testing platform, while developing and implementing automated testing solutions. Your expertise will contribute to the validation and verification of the BMS software within the SIL environment, ensuring its functionality, reliability, and adherence to industry best practices.

Responsibilities
Testing Platform Integration: Develop and execute strategies for seamless integration of the BMS software with the SIL testing platform, addressing any integration issues or conflicts. Ensure compatibility and functionality throughout the integration process. Build, configure, and maintain the SIL testing environment, including integrated BMS software, battery model simulators, and hardware/software simulation tools. Replicate real-world automotive environments for accurate testing.Test Automation: Implement and enhance automated test frameworks and tools to streamline the integration and testing process. Improve efficiency, facilitate regression testing, and ensure reliable and accurate results. Integrate test automation into the build and deployment processes, fostering continuous integration and continuous testing (CI/CT) practices for efficient and effective testing. Define comprehensive test guidelines that provide a clear understanding of the test platform's functionality. Identify the optimal tools for script coding, test plan generation, maintenance, and report generation. Consider integrating JAMA or other suitable tools to facilitate test run updates and reporting. Ensure effective communication, documentation, and traceability of test results.Collaboration and Improvement: Stay updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in test automation and SIL testing. Apply this knowledge to improve testing practices and enhance automated testing frameworks and tools. Collaborate with the test team to define test data, test models, and test environments required for automated testing. Ensure the availability of appropriate resources for comprehensive testing. Provide technical expertise and guidance to software engineers and test engineers regarding the integration process and best practices. Support the team and other stakeholders in leveraging the test platform effectively. Document the test platform architecture, integration processes, and guidelines for knowledge sharing and maintainability. Foster collaboration and ensure the scalability of the testing infrastructure.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.Strong Python skillsFluent in at least one of system-level programming languages: C, C++, RustExperience with embedded systemsHands-on experience with microcontrollers, electrical circuits and basic circuit design and analysisFluent of software fundamentals including software design, operating system, and compilerExperience with CI/CD/CTExperience of LinuxExperience of low-level driver and firmware development is a plusKnowledge of BMS system is a plusKnowledge of build system is a plusKnowledge of CAN is a plusExperience of automotive toolchain is a plusSelf-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently with minimal supervision.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to troubleshoot integration issues effectively.Strong communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Company Statements

Equal Opportunity

Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com .

Candidate Data Privacy

Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.

Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

companyDescription.text:
For over 15 years, BCjobs.ca has been connecting job seekers to leading companies in Greater Vancouver and throughout British Columbia. Focused on its community, BCjobs.ca understands the local hiring market, economy and companies that make up the fabric of our great province. Employees and management are all Vancouver-based and their connections with hiring managers and organizations brings job seekers the most rewarding and sought-after opportunities in a variety of professions and sectors.

In addition to finding people great jobs, BCjobs.ca is dedicated to workplace issues and career management resources to help both job seekers and hiring managers. Our news, research, reports and tools will help you through every step of your career and address management issues, including recruiting and retaining top talent.

We are dedicated to the communities in which we serve. BCjobs.ca -- your trusted career and workplace partner.

description.text:
We are looking for a Software Engineer with 5 years' experience to design and implement new applications and features!
SunTracker Technologies Ltd. ( www.suntrackertech.com ) is an innovative software firm with a flexible work environment located in beautiful Victoria, British Columbia.
We are looking for a Software Engineer with a minimum of 5 years' experience to design and implement new applications and features, as well as modify and maintain existing applications, related to our lighting design and rendering software.
Software Engineer Responsibilities Include
 Move Windows32 multithread applications to standard C++ and a move to a Linux server Design, develop, modify, implement, and support software components anywhere in the
software stack.
 Determine root cause for complex software issues and develop practical, efficient, and
permanent technical solutions.
 Mentor the development and delivery team to allow for skill/knowledge development through
advice, coaching, and training opportunities.
 Work in close partnership with cross-functional teams and management.
Software Engineer Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field. Significant programming experience in C++. Experience using OpenGL and interfacing with CAD engines. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the performance of duties.
An interest in lighting, and/or experience in games development will be of advantage.
Equivalencies will be considered. Everyone is encouraged to apply.
Please submit your Resume/CV to Wallace.scott@suntrackertech.com 
Images
Additional Info
Job Type : Full-Time
Location : Victoria, BC, Remote
Experience Level : Not Applicable

companyDescription.text: At ResMed (NYSE: RMD, ASX: RMD) we pioneer innovative solutions that treat and keep people out of the hospital, empowering them to live healthier, higher-quality lives. Our cloud-connected medical devices transform care for people with sleep apnea, COPD and other chronic diseases. Our comprehensive out-of-hospital software platforms support the professionals and caregivers who help people stay healthy in the home or care setting of their choice. By enabling better care, we improve quality of life, reduce the impact of chronic disease and lower costs for consumers and healthcare systems in more than 120 countries.

description.text:
Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build, deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You’ll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel, take informed risks, and drive ingenuity across the enterprise.

Let's Talk About The Team


Big ideas and big goals reign at ResMed. You will thrive in an environment filled with self-starters with the drive to make a difference. You will be encouraged within a people-focused culture that motivates and recognizes, so that together, we can produce the best products and results.

ResMed is seeking a software engineer to work with a talented development team in our Digital Health Technologies Product development group. The team is immersed in developing a software product platform to accelerate the development and delivery of innovative, patient-centric solutions for improving better outcomes for patients.

The ideal candidate will be a smart, motivated individual seeking an opportunity to work on large scale / high volume web applications writing code that is optimized for high performance, high availability, and scalability. You will work closely with our software developers and contribute to the development and implementation of a variety of internet driven applications for ResMed and our customers. You will be responsible for following policies and procedures, and maintaining best practices for the organization’s product environments. You will have strong analysis and design skills.

Let's Talk About The Role

Design, develop, implement, and deploy AWS cloud solutions.Provide incident management, change management, application support, monitoring, and Tier 2 support as part of full cycle team responsibilities. Ensures scalability, fault tolerance, and performance across all software they are responsible for.Work closely with technical architects, functional analysts, and product managers to translate requirements into technical solutions.Responsible for guarding, promoting, and establishing best practices within the team.Mentor junior members of the team.Perform code reviews and provide feedback, following coding standards and best practices, including secure coding guidelines.Write clear, well-commented, and easy to understand code.All engineers are expected to place a strong emphasis on writing automated tests, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end functional tests.Be part of an on-call support rotation.Other tasks and responsibilities as assigned.

Let's Talk About You

Strong object oriented design and programming skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to plan, prioritize and effectively manage tasks to achieve objectives.You enjoy learning and are committed to staying up to date with new and emerging technologies.Understanding of challenges associated with high availability, 24×7 applications and services.Experience with Amazon ECS, Amazon EKS, AWS Lambda, or Amazon EC2.Experience working with and managing container development, deployment and operations on AWS.Experience developing serverless applications using AWS Lambda, Dynamo DB, SNS, SQS, S3, Amazon API Gateway, Elasticsearch.Experience with Git, GitHub, Confluence, and JIRA.Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g. CodePipeline, GitHub Actions) and infrastructure as code tools (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation).Experience working with, or an understanding of, NoSQL databases and relational databases.Experience with test-driven development (TDD) is an asset.An understanding of 12-factor applications and cloud-native principles.Experience with various message-brokering architectures (pub/sub queues, request/response) and data streaming.AI, Machine Learning, and Data Engineering experience is an asset.Experience with mobile application development is an asset.Experience in Java, Node.js, Python, targeting multiple platforms (e.g. Windows, Linux) and application types (e.g. console, website, REST API).Experience with front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, React) and web services (e.g. Apache, Nginx, Amazon CloudFront).Experience with testing frameworks (e.g. Junit, Jest), and testing tools (e.g. JMeter, Postman).

Let's Talk About Qualifications And Experience

University Degree or College Diploma in Computer Science or Computer Programming or equivalent experience.6+ years experience in design and development of multi-tiered business applications; equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

companyDescription.text:
SRA Staffing Solutions specializes in Information Technology recruiting and project staffing. SRA is currently on the Vendor of Record’s for the Federal and Provincial Government and has established trusted relationships with multinational corporations and small software start-ups. Our offices are located all across Canada and our head office is based in North York, Ontario.

As a premier staffing firm, we have the market reach and capability to source highly talented consultants. Our clients will have access to a large, qualified pool of resources that are experienced in delivering services across business, technology and consulting verticals. 

Our goal is to make sure the right candidate is hired for each and every position whether it is a contract or a permanent placement. Our account executives are highly experienced staffing experts with well-grounded industry knowledge. Their experience, knowledge and dedication ensure that SRA delivers candidates who are well qualified for their specific positions. 
 
We successfully manage searches for businesses, large and small. Our success comes from fully understanding our clients’ needs and from our refined recruitment processes. As well, our communication and service priorities are second to none.

description.text:
The FinOps Engineer will be responsible for optimizing the financial performance of the WCB cloud infrastructure and applications. The FinOps Engineer will work closely with the Cloud and DevOps teams to identify cost-saving opportunities, optimize resource utilization, and develop financial reporting and governance mechanisms.
Key Responsibilities:
Optimize the financial performance of the WCB cloud infrastructure and applications;Collaborate with the Cloud and DevOps teams to identify cost-saving opportunities and optimize resource utilization;Develop financial reporting and governance mechanisms to track cloud spending and ensure compliance with budgetary constraints;Implement best practices for cost optimization and provide guidance to Cloud and DevOps teams;Continuously monitor and analyze cloud spending trends and identify areas for improvement; andEducate stakeholders on the financial implications of their cloud usage and provide recommendations for cost-effective alternatives. 
Minimum Relevant Experience:
Five (5) years of relevant work experience in financial management, cloud cost optimization, or a related field. 
Preferred Skills:
Financial management and analysis;Cloud cost optimization tools and techniques;Cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP);Cloud infrastructure and services such as virtual machines, containers, serverless computing, load balancing, auto-scaling, databases, and data storage services;Infrastructure as code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or ARM Templates. Data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Power BI; andThe FinOps Engineer should have experience in cloud cost optimization and financial management. The FinOps Engineer should be able to identify cost-saving opportunities and develop strategies to optimize cloud spending. The FinOps Engineer should have a strong understanding of cloud infrastructure and services, as well as experience with IaC tools. 
In addition to the technical skills required for the role, the FinOps Engineer should possess strong communication and analytical skills. The FinOps Engineer will be responsible for educating stakeholders on the financial implications of their cloud usage and providing recommendations for cost-effective alternatives. The FinOps Engineer will have a proven track record of optimizing cloud spending and improving financial performance.

description.text:
About Rivian

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

Responsibilities
Write software applications to test and simulate vehicle suspension control systemsContinually push technology to develop HIL/ MIL testing capabilities that can be included within a CI environment (Continuous Integration)Collaborate with software, test and integration teams to define the test requirements, test environment and pass/ fail criteriaPrimarily define and implement software unit tests and HIL regression tests, but also to be involved in vehicle/ rig tests in cases that require it
Qualifications
A degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Software Engineering focused on simulation1+ years of experience in automotive simulation or development (thermal management, body controls, dynamics)Experience with Matlab/ Simulink, C/C++, Python, Real Time Operating Systems, embedded systems, Linux, Microsoft Windows is desired.Ability to thrive under pressure and time constraints, apply creative and critically thinking to deliver exceptional resultsFamiliarity with the following: CAN, GIT, and Pytest is a plus.
Company Statements

Equal Opportunity

Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Candidate Data Privacy

Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.

ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - Canada only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Partial overlap)SALARY: $200,000 – $220,000/yrESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long termBRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6293

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements

Qualification:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Write clean, scalable software expressing industry best-practicesEstablish and enforce software development best practicesArchitect complex software systemsLead engineering efforts to implement software features, applications, and systemsCollaborate with engineers and business stakeholders to identify and implement software solutions to business problemsStay current with industry best-practices for software design and developmentMentor team membersAdditional duties assigned by your supervisor

Required Skills, Education and Certifications:
Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related field, preferred not required15+ years experience building production-grade software applications10+ years architecting complex software systems10+ years mentoring engineers10+ years experience working with JavaScript10+ years experience building web-based APIs (REST, GraphQL, etc)5+ years experience working with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate requirements into production software systems5+ years experience working with Node.jsStrong experience working with agile development teams

Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift and carry up to 10-15 poundsAbility to sit, stand and walk for prolonged periods of time throughout the work dayAbility to use standard office equipment such as personal computer, laptop, telephone, etc. What you’ll be working on

Job Summary / Purpose:

As a Staff Engineer you will be responsible for leading application architecture and software engineering for the most challenging software development projects at TheKey. You will be an active participant in conversations with business and technical stakeholders to understand business needs and the current capabilities of TheKey’s technology. You will propose novel technical solutions that apply current engineering best-practices to solve business needs with a scalable software solution. As part of implementation, you will identify the best software tools and approaches for development of specific applications and features, then lead engineering implementation using those tools/approaches. You will define best practices and software patterns for the rest of the engineering team, and help enforce these practices/patterns through code reviews and mentorship. You will independently design, build, review, deploy, and maintain production-grade software at the highest industry standards.

About TheKey:

For nearly 20 years, TheKey (formerly Home Care Assistance) has helped clients achieve successful long-term aging at home with comprehensive, concierge-based care. Ensuring the dignity, safety, and independence of its clients, TheKey is committed to changing how the world lives and ages at home. Employee-teams get the training, resources, and support they need to deliver an exceptional care experience for clients and their families. Founded in Silicon Valley, TheKey has grown from a single location to service coverage throughout North America enabling clients to live life on their own terms, in their own homes. View our video to learn more about TheKey.

Medical/Dental/Vision InsuranceTouchCare VirtualCareLife InsuranceHealth Savings AccountFlexible Spending Account401(k) MatchingEmployee Assistance ProgramPTO Plan for Non-Exempt EmployeesFlexible PTO Plan for Exempt EmployeesHolidays and Floating HolidaysPet Insurance

TheKey is an equal opportunity employer. TheKey prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Job title: Power Systems Studies EngineerLocation: Toronto, Montreal or several US offices could be considered
Whom are we recruiting for?
We are recruiting for a global-leading consultancy with significant international experience in power system studies for Renewable projects and major transmission interconnectors and are looking to grow that in America, particularly in North America in the next five years. Their growth will be achieved from a combination of delivery of technical excellence, development of the select intellectual property, and key client relationships on gigawatt-scale power developments.
What will you be doing?
Ability to execute load flow and steady-state studies, evaluation of transfer capability and security limits and short-circuit/fault studies to national and international standards.Ability to conduct and deliver transient stability analysis. Experience in EMT studies is considered a plus.Power System modeling – experience in PSS/E required and knowledge of ASPEN OneLiner, PowerGEM TARA, and PSCAD are considered a plus.Review and modify steady-state PSS/E models as needed for project-specific applicationsRemain up to date with ISO/RTO shifting market rules associated with system studies, reliability, and other interconnection requirements.

Are you the ideal candidate?
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Ph.D. is a plus for this position.• At least 2 years of hands-on experience in delivering power system studies using PSS/E, PowerGEM TARA, ASPEN Oneliner, and/or PSCAD. Knowledge of DigSILENT is not required but would be considered a plus.• Programming skills in Python, VBA, and/or MATLAB are highly desirable. Experience developing automation tools for power system studies is considered a plus.

What’s in it for you?
Competitive basic salary , plus bonusesHolidaysA flexible contributory pension scheme401k Plan
Who are we?
Executive Integrity is a global executive search and recruitment consultancy for a more sustainable world with a focus on the talent within the Maritime and Renewable Energy sectors. We give 1% of all our profits to Renewable World, a charity that develops affordable and innovative renewable energy solutions for poverty-stricken communities.

About Rivian

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

Role Summary

As a Sr. BMS HIL Integration Engineer, we want you to be responsible for Hardware-In-the-Loop testing of Battery Management System (BMS) software using your expertise and enthusiasm in development of test case and automation scripts. You will play a critical role in ensuring the reliability, functionality, and safety of our BMS software through comprehensive testing and the implementation of HIL automated testing solutions.

Responsibilities
 Work with cross functional teams (BMS software including but not limited to algorithm, controls, firmware, HIL, systems, mechanical, and electrical) to develop the test cases for system and subsystem HILs, lab car, electrical bench, SIL, and unit test. Verify test cases to ensure they are all testable and automatable. Develop and maintain test scripts for HIL. Be capable of writing SIL test cases whenever needed. Manage the traceability of test coverage from requirements to validation at different granularity levels of requirements on the HIL with growing SW maturity levels. Be able to report the test coverage progress to the leadership on a regular basis. Triage and debug the failed test cases and communicate bugs and software gaps to relevant stakeholders. Investigate and resolve failed and erroneous test cases, distinguishing between software bugs and HIL-related failures. Develop and maintain test plans across multiple programs, considering their respective maturity levels. Maintain and update calibrations in test cases, ensuring proper parameterization in accordance with software parity. Act as a stakeholder for Engineering Sign-Off (ESO) activities related to BMS. Distribute test cases across different system and subsystem HILs, lab car, electrical bench, and SIL/unit test to optimize the validation costs while maintaining a high level of software qualification. Be able to perform FTA and DFMEA to identify test cases for any failure modes and corner cases.
Qualifications
 Minimum BS degree in Electrical/Electronics/Mechanical Engineering. MS degree is preferred. 4+ years' industry experience developing HIL test cases for BMS software features and regression test. Previous experience in HV battery or EV systems is required. Well versed in systems engineering, FTA, DFMEA, and DVP&R. Previous hands-on experience with validation report design according to ISO 26262, especially part 6 Experience with data acquisition and calibration software (CANalyzer, CANape or similar xcp/ccp interface tools, JTAG/DAP interface debuggers) Experience with flash tools and software release pipelines Experience with executing test cases independently on the HIL system Familiarity with model-based design and being able to view and analyze models and C codes (development experience is a plus) Experience with requirement and issue tracking management tools Ability to work in a fast-paced development environment. Good team player with great communication skills. Self-motivated: Demonstrated ability to set direction and guide the team towards it.

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.

companyDescription.text:
Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) began exposing key infrastructure services to businesses in the form of web services -- now widely known as cloud computing. The ultimate benefit of cloud computing, and AWS, is the ability to leverage a new business model and turn capital infrastructure expenses into variable costs. Businesses no longer need to plan and procure servers and other IT resources weeks or months in advance. Using AWS, businesses can take advantage of Amazon's expertise and economies of scale to access resources when their business needs them, delivering results faster and at a lower cost.

Today, Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. With data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, customers across all industries are taking advantage of our low cost, elastic, open and flexible, secure platform.

description.text:
Description
The AI Data Team in Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a forward-looking and collaborative Language Engineer to join us in developing solutions for natural language data collections. This position is an opportunity to apply your expertise in a challenging but supportive environment.
The mission of the AI Data Team is to engineer the datasets critical to the success of AWS’s machine learning services. From chatbots to subtitles to search results and beyond, these products support dozens of languages and impact millions of people every day. We are a group of language engineers, linguists, data scientists, data engineers, and program managers, and we partner closely with the science, engineering, and product teams. We are customer obsessed and committed to delivering results with the highest quality and integrity.
As a Language Engineer, you will start by diving deep into a couple of critical projects for Transcribe spoken language understanding (SLU) services to drive these projects forward. You will consult with fellow language engineers, program managers, as well as stakeholders in science, engineering, and product teams to understand the role data plays in developing models that meet customer needs. You will analyze, follow, and improve processes for annotating transcribed conversations, assessing data quality and automating where appropriate.
You will then expand your scope by using the principles of data-centric AI to understand the role our data plays with regard to model performance specifically, as well as the larger ML pipeline. You will apply state-of-the-art ML and NLP techniques to analyze how well our data represents human language and run experiments to gauge downstream interactions. You will work collaboratively with other language engineers and scientists to design and implement principled strategies for data optimization.
Key job responsibilities
Source, validate, and deliver high-quality language artifacts and linguistic dataCollaborate with stakeholders to design data collection and development effortsOversee the progress and quality of several transcription and annotation projects at a timeAdvocate for strict adherence to data collection guidelines and quality thresholdsExtend existing data collection, annotation, and quality assurance efforts to support new feature and language expansionInnovate on data collection methodologies, guidelines, quality metrics to support new requestsAutomate repetitive workflows and improve existing processes
Basic Qualifications
PhD in Computational Linguistics, Linguistics with a computational component, or an equivalent field; alternatively, MA with 3+ years of experienceExcellent knowledge of phonetics, phonology, conversation analysis, and/or discourse analysisPractical knowledge of speech processing techniques and tools for segmenting, labelling, and analyzing speechProficiency in Python and other analytics tools such as R to process and analyze language dataExperience owning and executing data collection projects, including guidelines, labelset and annotation workflow developmentExperience developing and evaluating data annotation and data quality metrics
Preferred Qualifications
Ability to explain complex concepts and solutions in easy-to-understand termsExperience with synthetic dataset creationExperience working in the medical domainExperience working with a diverse array of languages or language varietiesPractical knowledge of version control systems such as GitHub
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.
Company - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC
Job ID: A2385324

What You’ll Be Working On

Our client is looking for a talented senior engineer, with interest in open ended problem solving and building scalable artificial intelligence (AI) software to join their cutting-edge AI startup. As the first senior technical hire you will be responsible for the full software life cycle behind their web-based AI software systems.

You will be expected to help in establishing and leading their engineering team and in developing a high-performance culture within the group. You will take ownership of managing the design, implementation, testing, and delivery of their AI software systems, while championing software development best practices, such as creating and managing project plans, code reviews, and agile development methodologies. You will also work alongside their founders to develop and execute their AI vision and to ensure their solutions always align with their clients' needs.

The company is an AI company on a mission to build the highest quality AI assistants through constant innovation, and cutting edge software. They offer a unique and exciting opportunity for career growth in a fast-paced environment. As they rapidly expand our client's AI solutions and explore new business domains, there are endless possibilities for you to learn and develop new skills.

The team practices agile development methodologies and values innovation, so you can expect to work on many different challenges and collaborate to solve open ended problems. Expect to learn new things: They prioritize fostering a culture of continuous learning for all our client's employees, by providing opportunities for training, attending events and conferences, and collaborating with industry experts.

The Business Analytics team within Fidelity Canada ULC’s finance department supports various business units and the senior executive team with advanced analytical solutions to support decision making. In collaboration with IT, the team works with internal clients on leveraging data, establishing patterns and customer journeys, as well as identifying and communicating significant business trends.
The Senior Analyst, Advanced Analytics positions plans, designs, develops, and deploys analytical solutions throughout the organization, while objectively evaluating the effectiveness of various sales and marketing activities using various data mining techniques.
What You Will Do
Works with key stakeholders to understand the business problem and translate it into appropriate analytics solution.Works independently on complex analyses using machine learning and statistical modelling techniques while leveraging both open source (R/Python, JupyterHub) and proprietary tools (KNIME, RapidMiner)Marketing, events, sales campaign analysis (AB tests, Pre vs. Post)Works with technology groups to bring models to production and to identify and resolve any data, environment, or implementation issuesStory telling with the help visualization tools (PowerPoint, Tableau, PowerBI, R-Shiny etc.)Enhance existing data visualization capabilities for Sales, Marketing, Leadership teamDevelop flexible backend and front-end systems to support the modelling, data visualization and analytics solutionsDate engineering, Ad-hoc data management and periodic reportingSharing of knowledge, best practices with the team including coaching or training in some of deep learning/machine learning methodologies. Provides mentoring, coaching, and consulting advice and guidance to staff, e.g. analytic methodologies, data recommendationsEvaluates/develops, advance tools, methodologies or infrastructure to support long-term business problems and take the group to the next level, e.g. modelling software, modelling methodologies, data and system requirements, scoring process, optimization environment
What We’re Looking For
University degree (Business, Analytics, Math/Statistics or Computer Science related) or related work experience3-5 years of experience employing various statistical modelling and data analysis techniques, such as linear / logistic regression, decision trees, affinity analysis, clustering/segmentation and time series forecastingExperience in Marketing and digital analytics using Adobe Stack, Marketo, Google AnalyticsDemonstrated proficiency with enterprise data mining tools like SAS, RapidMiner, KNIME, AlteryxExperience with business intelligence software (Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, Cognos etc.)Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel, SQL and PowerPoint
The Expertise You Bring
Ability to communicate quantitative data into a visually engaging story Experience applying advanced consumer intelligence / marketing techniquesExperience deciphering complex data and effectively communicating results to stakeholdersExcellent time management skills with ability to work in a high performing culture with time sensitive deadlinesSolid interpersonal and organizational skills combined with the ability to adapt to rapidly changing business environmentsAbility to work both independently and as part of a team; a self-starter with a positive attitudeGenuine interest in capital markets, financial industry, banking, future state of technology like artificial intelligence & machine learning
The Following Are Assets
Knowledge and experience in financial services, with a focus on the investment industryGraduate degree in statistics, mathematics or computer scienceExperience in Adobe Analytics, digital analytics, marketing and advertisingCertification in KNIME, RapidMiner, SAS or SPSS, Snowflake, TableauExperience in working with APIs and real time data connectivity to various service providers
Some of the ways we’ll help you feel valued and supported as part of our team
Flexible working arrangements - 100% remote, hybrid, and in office options.Competitive total compensation, including company contributions to your group RRSP without a matching requirement from youComprehensive health benefits that start on your first day, with 100% employer-paid premiums, that include up to $5000 annually for mental health services and therapyParental leave top-up to 100% of your salary for a period of 25 weeksUp to $650 for home office equipmentGenerous time off policy, including 2 paid days annually to volunteer at a charity of your choiceDiversity and inclusion programs, including an active network of Employee Resource GroupsExtensive professional development opportunities, including access to over 11,000 training and development courses, tuition reimbursement, and monetary rewards for completing a required designation 
We care a lot about fostering a compassionate, people-centric culture, and are proud to have been named one of Canada’s Top 100 employers for the last five years.
Fidelity Canada is an equal opportunity employer 
Fidelity Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, family status, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected ground.
Accommodation during the application process
Fidelity Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please email us at FidelityCanadaStaffing@fidelity.ca.
No telephone inquiries or agencies please. We thank all applicants for their interest, please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Why Work at Fidelity?
We are proud to be recipients of the following
Awards
Canada's Top Family-Friendly Employers 2023 (7th consecutive year) Canada's Top 100 Employers 2023 (7th consecutive year) Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2023 (10th consecutive year) Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023 Venngo Healthy Workplaces Award Workplace Benefits Awards – Health and Wellness ProgramHRDC Best Places to Work 2022

description.text:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: MST | Partial overlap)HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $25 – $55/hrESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Long termBRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6645

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements Experience Expectations:
5+ years of experience developing web applications using modern web frameworks (React preferred)Strong understanding of REST APIs, microservices, and security protocols5+ years of experience with serverless technologies like AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, or Azure Functions (AWS Preferred)Strong database development experience (Mongo preferred) and data modeling experience a plusExperience with containerization and cloud platforms (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, AWS)Proficiency with Git tasksExcellent open-ended problem-solving skillsStrong communication, collaboration and people management skills

What You’ll Be Working On

Our client is looking for a talented senior engineer, with interest in open ended problem solving and building scalable artificial intelligence (AI) software to join their cutting-edge AI startup. As the first senior technical hire you will be responsible for the full software life cycle behind their web-based AI software systems.

You will be expected to help in establishing and leading their engineering team and in developing a high-performance culture within the group. You will take ownership of managing the design, implementation, testing, and delivery of their AI software systems, while championing software development best practices, such as creating and managing project plans, code reviews, and agile development methodologies. You will also work alongside their founders to develop and execute their AI vision and to ensure their solutions always align with their clients' needs.

The company is an AI company on a mission to build the highest quality AI assistants through constant innovation, and cutting edge software. They offer a unique and exciting opportunity for career growth in a fast-paced environment. As they rapidly expand our client's AI solutions and explore new business domains, there are endless possibilities for you to learn and develop new skills.

The team practices agile development methodologies and values innovation, so you can expect to work on many different challenges and collaborate to solve open ended problems. Expect to learn new things: They prioritize fostering a culture of continuous learning for all our client's employees, by providing opportunities for training, attending events and conferences, and collaborating with industry experts.

Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain the web-based AI applications using modern web frameworks (React)Develop APIs, microservices, and serverless functions that integrate with our client's AI solutionsDevelop and maintain databases, including data modeling, optimization, and administration (Mongo experience preferred)Work with their chief AI scientists to integrate AI models into the web applicationsWrite clean, testable, and scalable code following best practicesParticipate in code reviews to ensure code quality and proper version controlTroubleshoot and debug issues across the entire technology stackWork with the latest web technologies, including serverless computing, microservices, containers, and cloud platformsStay up-to-date with emerging AI and Cloud technologies and industry trends

Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

ABOUT US:

Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.
JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)LOCATION: Remote - Canada only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Partial overlap)SALARY: $200,000 – $220,000/yrESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long termBRAINTRUST JOB ID: 6293

THE OPPORTUNITY

Requirements

Qualification:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Write clean, scalable software expressing industry best-practicesEstablish and enforce software development best practicesArchitect complex software systemsLead engineering efforts to implement software features, applications, and systemsCollaborate with engineers and business stakeholders to identify and implement software solutions to business problemsStay current with industry best-practices for software design and developmentMentor team membersAdditional duties assigned by your supervisor

Required Skills, Education and Certifications:
Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related field, preferred not required15+ years experience building production-grade software applications10+ years architecting complex software systems10+ years mentoring engineers10+ years experience working with JavaScript10+ years experience building web-based APIs (REST, GraphQL, etc)5+ years experience working with stakeholders to define business requirements and translate requirements into production software systems5+ years experience working with Node.jsStrong experience working with agile development teams

Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift and carry up to 10-15 poundsAbility to sit, stand and walk for prolonged periods of time throughout the work dayAbility to use standard office equipment such as personal computer, laptop, telephone, etc. What you’ll be working on

Job Summary / Purpose:

As a Staff Engineer you will be responsible for leading application architecture and software engineering for the most challenging software development projects at TheKey. You will be an active participant in conversations with business and technical stakeholders to understand business needs and the current capabilities of TheKey’s technology. You will propose novel technical solutions that apply current engineering best-practices to solve business needs with a scalable software solution. As part of implementation, you will identify the best software tools and approaches for development of specific applications and features, then lead engineering implementation using those tools/approaches. You will define best practices and software patterns for the rest of the engineering team, and help enforce these practices/patterns through code reviews and mentorship. You will independently design, build, review, deploy, and maintain production-grade software at the highest industry standards.

About TheKey:

For nearly 20 years, TheKey (formerly Home Care Assistance) has helped clients achieve successful long-term aging at home with comprehensive, concierge-based care. Ensuring the dignity, safety, and independence of its clients, TheKey is committed to changing how the world lives and ages at home. Employee-teams get the training, resources, and support they need to deliver an exceptional care experience for clients and their families. Founded in Silicon Valley, TheKey has grown from a single location to service coverage throughout North America enabling clients to live life on their own terms, in their own homes. View our video to learn more about TheKey.

Benefits For Full Time Employees
Medical/Dental/Vision InsuranceTouchCare VirtualCareLife InsuranceHealth Savings AccountFlexible Spending Account401(k) MatchingEmployee Assistance ProgramPTO Plan for Non-Exempt EmployeesFlexible PTO Plan for Exempt EmployeesHolidays and Floating HolidaysPet Insurance

TheKey is an equal opportunity employer. TheKey prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply Now!

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
