description.text:
Position Title: Business Intelligence AnalystJob Class: Applications AnalystDept/Program: Data AnalyticsRate of Pay: $38.99-$46.37 per hourEmployment Type: Temporary Full Time up to 1 yearEmployee Group: OPSEUWork Schedule: 37.5 hours weekly as per schedulePosting Date: June 13th, 2023Posting Type: OpenNumber: 1Hybrid Eligible: Yes


Please Note: This position offers a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work. The successful candidate is REQUIRED to come onsite 3 days per week. Office location is 500 Church St. in Penetanguishene, ON.


The Director of Data Analytics and Health Information Management is currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team in delivering insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise to the organization. The Analyst will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and data visualizations in Power BI, building relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts, raising issues of data quality for continuous process improvement and creating effective written documentation of their outputs.



Key Accountabilities:
Identify business intelligence requirements, interpret, and establish viable data modelling to complete analytical and visualization outputs.Develop visualization tools using Power BI that follow best practices in the selection and use of data visualizations to provide insights and support evidence-based decision making.Provide analysis, which may include descriptive statistics, forecasting and/or predictive modelsCreate and maintain report documentation and user guides, ensuring requirements are current, updating manuals as required and ensuring system users are familiar with manuals and updates.Demonstrate tact and superior customer service skills in interacting directly with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to gather requirements, validate data and provide end-user training in resulting visualization tools (e.g. dashboards, reports).Acting as a consultant, providing expert advice, coaching and feedback on the work of others as it relates to capturing, analyzing, reporting and understanding data and information organization.Work to improve data literacy across the organization. Focus on improving the ability to access data & to understand potential insights from data.Support, follow and contribute to information governance and data standards established by the organization.Identify and document opportunities for improvement of data quality. Work in collaboration with decision support and clinical teams to determine root causes and business impacts.

Requirements/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree is required in the field of epidemiology, health information systems, computer science, computer programming or a related field.1-3 years’ experience in an analytic role (previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred)Proficiency using Power BI, or other data visualization technology.Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to key stakeholders, including all levels of management.Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.Strong ability to manage different stakeholder perspectives and resistance to change.Ability to influence and orient business executives and senior management audiences toward a common goal that is satisfies all stakeholders.Demonstrated experience with validating and auditing data and understanding data governance principles.Results-oriented with the work ethic to work independently and undertake tasks needed to accomplish work objectives and deliver quality, consistent and timely results.Experience using SQL or any database query language.Knowledge of analytical tools and technologies (e.g. Python, R).Previous experience with Electronic Medical Records is preferred.Proven ability to adapt to changing requests and competing priorities.Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.Models and promotes core ethical practices while demonstrating Waypoint Values, and reflects an optimistic and positive attitude.You must meet the requirements of our COVID-19 Immunization Policy by providing proof of full vaccination, or a request and receipt of an accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code, including a medical exemption


How do I apply?
Waypoint employees apply through the Employee Self-Service portal at https://employees.waypointcentre.ca and external applicants apply to http://www.waypointcentre.ca/i_want_to/join_your_team by quoting Job ID WC23-189 by close of business (5:00 pm) on June 30th, 2023. Attach your cover letter and resume detailing why you are interested in this opportunity and how you meet the qualifications and key accountabilities specified.

We are committed to diversity in the workplace and workplace well-being. As such, applications from individuals from diverse backgrounds such as First Nations, Inuit, Metis, members of a visible minority group and those with lived experience of mental health problems or illnesses are welcomed and encouraged. Waypoint welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Job Description:

Digital Solutions is a team of skilled professionals who dedicate their careers to accelerating the growth of Sun Life’s digital platforms through technology-based solutions. We focus on looking for and seizing opportunities to leverage data in new ways as we continue to help our Clients achieve lifetime financial security, live healthier lives and connect with us. Come join us as we continue to intensify the focus on our digital journey, helping our clients and transforming our business in exciting ways!

We are looking for an experienced Lead Software Engineer, proficient with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), to provide technical design, development, support and evaluation for large-scale content management applications and systems. The successful candidate is a team player with excellent technical and problem-solving skills, is aware of industry trends, questions the status quo and can identify and propose alternatives.

What will you do?
Design and develop robust new AEM components or modify existing ones, including their configuration, Java code, client libraries, and templates that meet business, technical and quality requirements.Provide technical guidance to AEM developers around best practices in AEM development - both back-end and front-end executionConfigure Apache/Dispatcher front-end web servers as needed for existing and new websites for web applications, integrations, and servicesReview and approve/decline pull requests for merging code into the main branches of Bitbucket repository.Work closely with onsite and offshore developers, as well as Product Owner and stakeholders.Assist technical support staff, project managers, and users as needed to support business applications by diagnosing complex production issues requiring extensive analysis and troubleshooting.Provide technical guidance to projects ensuring risks are mitigated and projects are implemented successfullyContribute to defining timelines and plans; research and estimate feasibility, cost, time and scope

What do you need to succeed?

companyDescription.text:
Crossover’s mission is to democratize access to impactful, high-paying jobs. We recruit and screen only people with exemplary skills and drive to work with the world's best businesses. 

With our scenario-based testing model, we match top talent around the world with opportunities to manage all types of initiatives, from software development to quality assurance to growing solution roadmaps.

We have over 3,500 partners in more than 116 countries. Everyone has their own Crossover story… What will yours be?

See what our partners have to say about working at Crossover:

description.text:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?
Are you a Software Architect with an unwavering commitment to well-engineered code who thrives in the fast-paced world of AWS cloud computing? Do you relish the challenge of leading product development, crafting, and executing complex architectural decisions? If you're driven by a passion for pushing the boundaries of what's possible in tech, then GT School is looking for you!
At GT School, we're not just developing software; we're revolutionizing education. Our groundbreaking data platform, CoachBot, empowers students to learn independently, with no teacher or tutor required. Through tight integration with numerous learning apps, CoachBot harnesses the power of analytics to assess student performance, delivering targeted real-time feedback and encouraging progress with innovative motivational techniques - including cash rewards!
What sets us apart? Our platform is 100% cloud-native, utilizing cutting-edge AWS technologies like Lambda, Step Functions, Glue, AppSync, and QuickSight. This means you'll spend less time maintaining old code and more time pioneering new solutions in a dynamic, ever-evolving tech landscape.
We believe that technical leadership shouldn't mean "graduating" to administration and management - here, you'll always be at the cutting edge, driving the design and development of new features. As our Principal Software Architect, you'll lead by example, delivering the most complex features and making the most challenging architectural decisions. You'll have the opportunity to inspire and shape a team of talented engineers, all while remaining hands-on and engaged with the technology you love.
If you're a strategic thinker with a proven track record in software architecture and cloud technologies, and you're ready to redefine the future of education, we'd love to hear from you!
What You Will Be Doing
Making the most complex architectural decisions in the productReviewing feature design proposals from other team members and simplifying themReviewing the code of other team members for simplicity and correctnessStandardizing best practices into playbooks to improve the quality of the whole team
Principal Software Engineer Key Responsibilities
Own the architecture and quality of the whole product
Basic Requirements
5+ years of experience in software development3+ years of experience in software architecture3+ years of experience developing using AWS cloud patterns
About Gt.school
gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
Working with Crossover
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4642-CA-Vancouve-PrincipalSoftw1.009

companyDescription.text:
Thales is a global technology leader with more than 77,000 employees on five continents. The Group is investing in digital and “deep tech” innovations – Big Data, artificial intelligence, connectivity, cybersecurity and quantum technology – to build a future we can all trust. Trust is essential for societies to flourish, with humans playing a central role in every critical decision.
Thales's high-tech solutions, services and products help companies, organisations and governments to achieve their goals and ambitions. And in each of our five vertical markets — digital identity and security, defence and security, aerospace, space, and transport — our customers play a vital role in society.

description.text:
Location: Ottawa 1 Chrysalis, Canada

In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.

For decades, Ottawa has been a global technology leader. Today, Canada’s capital holds one of the brightest and most diverse technological ecosystems in North America. Voted as Canada’s best place to live 2017 by Maclean's, Ottawa offers a low cost of living with a high quality of life. The Thales Ottawa office has been a major supplier and long-term trusted partner to DND, enabling the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast Guard to achieve mission success.

Position Summary

This role is Hybrid (Office/Home and Client site) Ottawa region.

In support of a recently awarded contract , the Senior Software Product and Innovation Engineer will be responsible for leading the technical vision for DSEF products and capabilities; developing technical architectures, frameworks and strategies to meet DSEF system requirements; and analyzing, design and implement DSEF produced systems and architectures.

Key Responsibilities

As a Senior Software Product and Innovation Engineer, you will be responsible for the following:
Designing, developing and assessing technical solutions to address complex DSEF system issues.Analyzing and evaluate alternative technology solutions to meet DSEF system problems.Ensuring the integration of all aspects of DSEF system and solutions.Recommending options for resolving DSEF system and design issues.Updating and evolving the DSEF products System Breakdown Structures.Define and document interfaces within DSEF sub-systems, to external systems and between new and existing systems.Producing, documenting and managing system architectural designs and guidance, with contributions from across all engineering and support disciplines, to achieve comprehensive DSEF system implementation.Performing any other related work as required.

Key Requirements

Minimum of 15 years of demonstrated experience as Software Architect, having experience with the majority of the following:
Lead the technical vision for software products and capabilities.Develop technical architectures, frameworks and strategies to meet software or system requirements.Analyze, design and implement software produced systems and architectures.Design, develop and assess technical solutions to address complex product issues.Data architecture development, definition, framework and implementation for software products & information systems.Software Integration: hardware and software, (COTS and/or custom developed) components into new or existing systems.Recommend options for resolving software or product system and design issues.Demonstrated experience in the field of Firepower, ISR, C4ISR, or Modelling and Simulation application development.Software life-cycle management.Minimum of 10 years of demonstrated experience as a Software Architect on Military Command and Control Software Information Products.Minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in the preparation of technical concept documents, system specifications, and technical proposals in the field of Information Technology / Information management or engineering.

Key Abilities:
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal – with the ability to communicate information technology frameworks/strategies to management and technical staff, as well as communicating system-engineering direction for projects or systems.Providing advice, guidance and recommendations on technical issues to support the decision-making of senior management.Leading multidisciplinary teams in the development of software applications, frameworks or strategies.Performing strategic, operational or tactical planning for projects or systems to meet corporate strategy. Proven problem solving and analytic skills with a track record of successful outcomesRecognized for ability to engage stakeholders at all levels of the organisation and externally with customers.Strong business acumen and ability to identify and address issues within a complex business environment.Capable of developing strong relationships across the business through excellent customer service.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in software, computer, systems, electrical, or a suitable engineering or technical field required to support Land C4ISR.

Compliance Regulations:
All applicants must be able to obtain a Canadian NATO Secret clearance and meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Registration Program and ITAR.

Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs.

Thales thanks all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

companyDescription.text: We provide customized data and analytics consulting services, including automation and software development for a sustainable and intuitive digital transformation.

description.text:
Position Overview:
We are looking for a Senior Business Analytics Consultant to join our team here at ShyftLabs! We are currently searching for someone who loves data and advanced analytics, and is able to both understand and develop overall business strategies. A blend of great technical skills and interpersonal skills is highly desirable in this role, which will be working alongside Enterprise clients.
ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.
Job Responsibilities:
Design quality technical solutions to meet client business objectives.
Developing and testing data models to capture client’s KPIs and data transformations.
Working with client stakeholders to develop end to end Cloud based solutions with a heavy focus on applications and data.
Contribution to the vision, understanding our product roadmap, integrating business value with experience and contributing towards building an engineering culture within the team.
Delivering highly reliable software and data pipelines using automation, version control, continuous integration, testing and security that will aggregate the reporting metrics needed in a Retail Data Platform.
Create extensive Machine Learning models and predictive models.
Ensure consistency in delivering quality solutions.
Resolve and identify technical issues continuously.
Teach and learn new technologies and tools within the industry.
The Ideal Candidate:
Has 5+ years of experience in data and a minimum 2+ years of retail experience.
Has a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics related discipline.
Client-facing experience and exposure to Executive level stakeholders is a must have.
Experience developing Machine Learning models is a must have.
Has worked on Cloud Data warehouses such as Snowflake Or BigQuery.
Experience with SQL, Python, R, and Looker.
Experience in a distributed source control such as GIT in an Agile- Scrum environment (Airflow experience is a plus).
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
Can identify ways to improve data quality and reliability.
Is aligned with latest data trends or inconsistencies to simplify the data insights.
Has both excellent verbal and written communication skills.
A commitment to teamwork with excellent interpersonal skills are essential.
We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is able to be fully remote within Canada. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

companyDescription.text:
OUR STORY 
Staffing Services by GardaWorld started in 2014 in response to a market opportunity. We recognized that our success in recruiting, training and scheduling talent, as well as doing payroll could be applied beyond the security industry. Our growth began in Quebec with the acquisition of Helene Roy Staffing agency, and continued from there. 
 
In 2019, we expanded our services into Ontario with the acquisition of The Bagg Group (Toronto) and Turn Key Staffing Solutions (GTA + North). Although we love the GardaWorld brand and everything it stands for, it’s time to step out on our own and create a name for ourselves. Literally. 
 
Welcome to TalentWorld. Good things start here.
 
HOW CAN WE HELP? 
We exist to create meaningful relationships between people and their employers. With TalentWorld, people can find the ideal job that showcases their talent, fuels their passion, and meets their unique wants. And employers can find the ideal people to help shape their business. 
 
Are you looking for your next challenge? Whether you’re searching for a permanent role that supports your career growth plan, or a temporary position to help you fund your side-hustle, we’ve got your back.

Are you looking for talented people to join your team? Then you’re in the right place. TalentWorld is a full-service recruitment and staffing agency that specializes in outsourcing, without losing the human element. We’re on a mission to bring back a sense of depth in an industry that’s about speed and automation.

description.text:
TalentWorld is currently seeking a Testing Engineer for our client, whom is a global leader in electrical product safety certifications in  Newmarket . Working with this client offers lots of learning and growth potential, in a welcoming family like environment.
In this position, you would be leading testing on electric vehicle and energy storage at the module and pack level. Reporting into the Site Operations Manager, your role would be responsible for conducting specific testing and reporting to the requirements of f ISO/IEC 17025 accreditation.
Testing Engineer Responsibilities
 Relevant testing on electronic vehicle and energy storage systems  Maintain and populate proper documentation using various media - example: Reports, photography and video  Utilize a variety of instrumentation and equipment  Perform product certification assessments and calibrations  Maintain confidentiality of customers, products tested, and appropriate internal information 
Testing Technician Qualifications
 Bachelor’s degree in n Electrical, Mechanical, or Materials Engineering, or equivalent experience  5 years experience in testing of electric vehicle and/or energy storage systems  Knowledge of lithium battery technology and safety protocols is mandatory  Experience in test method development and execution, instrumentation and data acquisition, and safety systems.  Testing Experience, using and maintaining testing equipment  Familiarity with connected area network bus, internet protocol, and RS232. 
Employment Details

companyDescription.text:
Thales is a global technology leader with more than 77,000 employees on five continents. The Group is investing in digital and “deep tech” innovations – Big Data, artificial intelligence, connectivity, cybersecurity and quantum technology – to build a future we can all trust. Trust is essential for societies to flourish, with humans playing a central role in every critical decision.
Thales's high-tech solutions, services and products help companies, organisations and governments to achieve their goals and ambitions. And in each of our five vertical markets — digital identity and security, defence and security, aerospace, space, and transport — our customers play a vital role in society.

description.text:
Location: Ottawa 1 Chrysalis, Canada
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
For decades, Ottawa has been a global technology leader. Today, Canada’s capital holds one of the brightest and most diverse technological ecosystems in North America. Voted as Canada’s best place to live 2017 by Maclean's, Ottawa offers a low cost of living with a high quality of life. The Thales Ottawa office has been a major supplier and long-term trusted partner to DND, enabling the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast Guard to achieve mission success.
Position Summary
This position is hybrid (Office, home and client site) Ottawa.
In support of a recently awarded contract, the Senior Software Product and Innovation Engineer will be responsible for leading the technical vision for DSEF products and capabilities; developing technical architectures, frameworks and strategies to meet DSEF system requirements; and analyzing, design and implement DSEF produced systems and architectures.
Key Responsibilities
As a Senior Software Product and Innovation Engineer, you will be responsible for the following:
Designing, developing and assessing technical solutions to address complex DSEF system issues.Analyzing and evaluate alternative technology solutions to meet DSEF system problems.Ensuring the integration of all aspects of DSEF system and solutions.Recommending options for resolving DSEF system and design issues.Updating and evolving the DSEF products System Breakdown Structures.Define and document interfaces within DSEF sub-systems, to external systems and between new and existing systems.Producing, documenting and managing system architectural designs and guidance, with contributions from across all engineering and support disciplines, to achieve comprehensive DSEF system implementation.Performing any other related work as required.
Key Requirements
Minimum of 15 years of demonstrated experience as Software Architect, having experience with the majority of the following:
Lead the technical vision for software products and capabilities.Develop technical architectures, frameworks and strategies to meet software or system requirements.Analyze, design and implement software produced systems and architectures.Design, develop and assess technical solutions to address complex product issues.Data architecture development, definition, framework and implementation for software products & information systems.Software Integration: hardware and software, (COTS and/or custom developed) components into new or existing systems.Recommend options for resolving software or product system and design issues.Demonstrated experience in the field of Firepower, ISR, C4ISR, or Modelling and Simulation application development.Software life-cycle management.Minimum of 10 years of demonstrated experience as a Software Architect on Military Command and Control Software Information Products.Minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in the preparation of technical concept documents, system specifications, and technical proposals in the field of Information Technology / Information management or engineering.
Key Abilities
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal – with the ability to communicate information technology frameworks/strategies to management and technical staff, as well as communicating system-engineering direction for projects or systems.Providing advice, guidance and recommendations on technical issues to support the decision-making of senior management.Leading multidisciplinary teams in the development of software applications, frameworks or strategies.Performing strategic, operational or tactical planning for projects or systems to meet corporate strategy. Proven problem solving and analytic skills with a track record of successful outcomesRecognized for ability to engage stakeholders at all levels of the organisation and externally with customers.Strong business acumen and ability to identify and address issues within a complex business environmentCapable of developing strong relationships across the business through excellent customer service
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in software, computer, systems, electrical, or a suitable engineering or technical field required to support Land C4ISR.
Preferred Qualifications
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification
All applicants must be able to obtain a Canadian NATO Secret clearance and meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Registration Program and ITAR.
Thales is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applicants from the four designated groups (women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and aboriginals) to apply for employment. At Thales, we provide accessibility to people with disabilities. Should you require accommodations, please consult with your recruitment office and they will work with you to make any adjustments that best suit your individual needs.
Thales thanks all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

At Finastra our purpose is to unlock the power of finance for everyone & redefine finance for good. We’re the orchestrator of open finance; building and delivering innovative, next-generation technology on our open Fusion software architecture and cloud ecosystem. We’re one of the world’s largest FinTechs, working with over 9,000 customers including 90 of the top 100 banks globally. 

We’re creating a pioneering open platform that’s disrupting the financial industry, changing how financial software is developed and used. We believe in collaboration for innovation, to unlock the potential of people, businesses and communities. We have an unmatched portfolio of financial software and deliver mission critical solutions for financial institutions of all sizes, on premises or in the cloud. Our open architecture and platform approach embrace a wide ecosystem of partners and co innovators. Together we're leading the way in which applications are written, deployed and consumed in the world of financial services. 

Our people mission is to be the most loved and inclusive fintech company in the world; a mission we take seriously. DE&I factors into everything we do and every decision we make as a business. When you join Finastra, you open up a world of possibilities. With us, you can supercharge financial institutions, big tech and fintech while also building a more inclusive finance industry. 

We believe our people thrive when allowed to be their authentic selves and we trust our people to work how, when and where they want; this is OPENworking. We are taking a hybrid approach to work in the workplace with the flexibility to also work from home. Upon joining your manager will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model and frequency required in the workplace.

Our people take as much leave as they need; we do not count vacation days and we trust our people to work in a way that suits them.
 
Come join the future of Fintech, and make your world. OPEN.

description.text:
Responsibilities

About the role:

The Senior Systems Engineer (MQ Administrator) is responsible for supporting software used for a variety of our applications used for Real Time Payments, P2G, Loan Payments, Wire transfer, Global Funds Exchange, Swift messaging, GPP, Total Payments, Messaging and Mobile Payment Systems on Finastra servers in Azure cloud or data centers, managed by Finastra Applications Operations teams. Finastra financial products provide business application functions necessary to support the delivery of domestic and international wire transfers for bank and bank customers through the Federal Reserve Bank’s Fedwire network and the international SWIFT network.

The Sr Systems Engineer is responsible for architecture, installation, configuration, support and maintenance of all middleware application softwares specifically Messaging technologies, customer’s file transfer technology, automate job schedule, log monitoring software, cert and key administration, application monitoring, new server installations and configuration, and infrastructure projects.

This is a full-time position, which requires a great deal of patience and attention to detail. We are looking for the right person to both control the current environment and plan for our future needs. This position will manage, scale, and maintain our application servers necessary to grow with our business. Further, this person will be tasked with improving both internal and external support for our vital operations.

What You'll Do
Design, Install and configure IBM MQ/RDQM server software.Provides technical support and maintenance of installed MQ software.Make sure all the required monitoring services in place for reporting about system HA and performance.Interacts with business users and software vendors to troubleshoot installation and implementation issues.Works with system administrators/DBAs/networking engineers to improve ongoing services delivery.Develops and maintains detailed technical knowledge of the specifications, operation, and diagnostics of products while maintaining familiarity with competing products.Organizes, produces, and reports on the progress of ongoing testing, trials, and evaluation of new products and services.Analyzes existing workflow environments and assists with setting up and configuring new installations to fit into workflow models.Conducts orientation to new users regarding applications of software.Works with team members and management to architect and support high availability platforms and automate failover to disaster recovery locations.

What you'll need:
6-8 years of overall IT experience3-5 years of level 2/level 3 support experience in a fast-paced technical environmentExperience with IBM MQ/RDQM is requiredExperience with Active MQ is plusProficient with Apache Web Server, IIS web servers, Tomcat/Jboss/WebSphere/Weblogic app servers is plusExperience with Azure/AWS cloud infrastructure is a plusScripting using powershell, cmd, perl, phpProficiency with the standard Unix/Linux and Windows interfaces is requriedExperience with electronic file transfer technologies is a plusExperience with Automated job schedule is a plus is a plusExperience with Oracle Report Server/Obiee/PowerBI is a plusFamiliarity with communication protocols such as FTP, SSH, and SSL SSL Public, Private key certificate knowledge, PGP, Regular expressions are plusFamiliarity with the SWIFT Network, SNL and HSMs is a plusGood troubleshooting skills and ability to perform under pressureGood documentation, organization and follow-up skillsExcellent written and oral communication skills

Fondée en 1892, l’entreprise figure au nombre des grandes sociétés publiques au pays. description.text:
Description
L'analyste en données a une compréhension détaillée des données des secteurs d'activité en gestion de patrimoine. Cette personne comprend les flux de données et connaît la qualité des données associées afin de conseiller sur les bonnes actions à prendre dès le début des initiatives et est donc la personne de référence au sein de son équipe pour les questions relatives aux données.
Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes
Comprendre la stratégie, les défis et la réalité opérationnelle de la ligne d'activité que nous soutenons afin de guider les équipes informatiques dans le développement de solutions innovantes et efficaces qui répondent aux objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise ; Identifier l'adéquation entre les besoins de l'entreprise et les données.Comprendre les exigences des utilisateurs professionnels et les traduire en spécifications précises pour les équipes de développement, en particulier en ce qui concerne les règles commerciales complexes, les mesures et les questions liées à la qualité des données.Assembler et maintenir un portrait détaillé de la qualité des données à l'aide de différents outils.Contribuer aux efforts visant à améliorer la qualité, la gouvernance, la disponibilité et l'accessibilité des données et veiller à l'alignement sur les pratiques existantes en matière de gestion des données ; analyser les processus et proposer des modifications afin d'améliorer la qualité des données.Travailler en collaboration avec les responsables des données, les architectes de solutions, les architectes de données et les modélisateurs de données.Contribuer à l'élaboration et à la mise à jour de la feuille de route en matière de données pour le secteur d'activité.
Qualifications
5-10 ans d'expérience en tant qu'analyste informatique, dont au moins 5 ans en tant qu'analyste de données.Solide compréhension des principes fondamentaux de l'architecture des données, de la modélisation des données et de la qualité des données.Connaissance du langage SQL et d'au moins un outil de gestion de la qualité ou des données (Ataccama, Collibra ou autre).Proactivité et autonomieCapacité d'adaptation ; nous sommes en pleine transformation ! Votre rôle évoluera avec nos façons de faire et nos systèmes.Souci du détailDésir d'approfondir ses connaissances dans le domaine de la gestion de patrimoine, requisBonnes aptitudes linguistiques en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit en raison des interactions fréquentes avec des collègues et clients anglophones et francophones à travers le Canada.Connaissance de la gestion de patrimoine ou de l'investissement en général, un atout

description.text:
Description
This client supports next generation avionic modems for the defense/military industry. The DSP Engineer will be a key member of an Avionics product development team.
The avionics company has applied superior techniques in analysis, design, test and verification to create and develop new and innovative technologies for military and commercial applications. Their expertise in advanced, real-time, multi-channel data communications has led to remarkable advances in performance in both wireless and wired communications solutions while delivering affordable and rapidly deployable systems to both the military and commercial markets.
Responsibilities
 Participate in algorithm development, MATLAB and C/C++ PHY layer modeling (floating and fixed point), performance validation via analysis and test benches, write technical design specification. Contribute to the definition and modeling of an adaptive interference canceller. Investigate technical solutions for a programmable digital up-converter. Carry out both proof-of-concept. Design a hybrid Matlab/C test environment for verification of h/w implementation against C models. Devise test cases for block level testing of various functional modules. Troubleshoot the cause of various failures observed in the lab on a running system, leverage algorithmic, software and systems level knowledge with strong debug skills. Modify embedded software to fix bugs and add new features.
Top Skills Details
Dsp, Algorithm, C++, Algorithm development, DSP algorithm, Real time embedded, MATLAB, Simulink, Python, Microprocessor, Linux, Digital signal processing, Fpga, C++ programming, Embedded software
Additional Skills & Qualifications
 DSP design/development experience. C/C++ programming (Real-time) Matlab/Simulink experience Strong debugging experience
Work Location:
2-3x a week on-site in Ottawa, ON.

companyDescription.text:
La GRICS est la plus importante entreprise de technologie de l’information spécialisée en éducation au Québec. 

Nous sommes un organisme sans but lucratif qui développe, adapte et soutient la plus vaste gamme de solutions de gestion de données ainsi que de gestion administrative, scolaire et pédagogique faites sur mesure pour le monde de l’éducation. 

Plus de 2 millions de Québécois utilisent nos produits pour simplifier leur travail, mieux communiquer entre eux et augmenter leur productivité... principalement les employés du réseau de l’éducation, les enseignants, les élèves et leurs parents. 

Notre offre 
 o +/- 30 solutions logicielles 
 o Soutien technique et fonctionnel 
 o Implantation de nouvelles solutions 
 o Formation 
 o Accompagnement et consultation 
 o Élaboration de contenu 
 o Hébergement de solutions

description.text:
Depuis plus de 35   ans, la GRICS d é veloppe, adapte et soutient la plus vaste gamme de solutions de gestion des donn é es scolaires, p é dagogiques et administratives faites sur mesure pour le monde de l’éducation. Nous sommes fiers d’être la plus importante entreprise en technologie de l’information spécialisée en éducation au Québec   !
 Vos nouveaux défis et responsabilités 
Le secteur des Solutions en valorisation des données et intégration est le maître d’œuvre de la réalisation de solutions en intelligence d’affaires, en intelligence artificielle et intégration répondant à la vision, les stratégies et les priorités organisationnelles. Votre rôle consistera à assurer l’identification des besoins du réseau, collaborer à l’élaboration et à la réalisation de projets en intelligence artificielle. Vous serez amené à produire des analyses en lien avec différents produits de données.
Entre autres :
 Participer à l’exploration, au développement et à l’opérationnalisation de solutions complètes reposant sur l’analytique avancée ou l’intelligence artificielle pour répondre à des problématiques en éducation   ;  Collaborer étroitement avec les scientifiques de données des différents secteurs et équipes dans la création d’algorithmes et des modèles d’apprentissage automatique, afin de mener à bien des initiatives à impact positif sur la clientèle et sur le domaine de l’éducation   ;  Être impliqué dans des projets qui ont pour but d’optimiser l’utilisation et la mesure de la valeur des initiatives analytiques (ex. rédaction de normes, vulgarisation de l’analytique avancé et de l’apprentissage machine, amélioration continue du cycle de vie, ou méthodologie de mesure de la valeur de projets analytiques)   ;  S’immerger dans le domaine d’affaires et comprendre sa réalité   ;  Démontrer un leadership et agir en tant que personne ‐ ressource dans le domaine de l’intelligence artificielle, tant à l’interne qu’avec la clientèle et les partenaires   ;  Élaborer, tenir à jour et améliorer les modèles   ;  Accomplir toutes autres tâches liées au poste. 
 Votre profil 
 Détenir un diplôme terminal d’études universitaires de deuxième cycle ou supérieur dans un champ de spécialisation approprié : science des données, actuariat, mathématiques appliquées ou statistiques   ;  OU  
 Détenir un diplôme terminal d’études universitaires de premier cycle en sciences des données, en actuariat, en mathématiques appliquées ou statistiques, combiné à une certification complémentaire ou une formation équivalente pertinente au domaine d’expertise, tel que :  Certification Microsoft en intelligence artificielle   ;  Posséder une expérience démontrée en intelligence artificielle, et plus spécifiquement en machine learning, ou dans d’autres secteurs connexes, idéalement appliquée au domaine de l’éducation   ;  Connaissances approfondies de principes entourant les entrepôts de données, les lacs de données et performer dans la manipulation de grands volumes de données   ;  Capacité remarquable à travailler sur des programmes complexes et de grandes envergures en matière de données   ;  Compréhension de la gouvernance des données et de ses outils   ;  Forte connaissance en langage de programmation Python   ;  Connaissance avérée dans les systèmes ou logiciels suivants (ou leurs équivalents) : Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Azure DevOps (TFS), SQL (connaissance des requêtes de bases et des différents schémas SQL) ;  Esprit d’analyse et de logique   ;  Excellente gestion de son temps, habileté à gérer plusieurs priorités simultanément afin d’être en mesure de respecter les échéanciers   ;  Excellente capacité rédactionnelle, tolérance à l’ambiguïté, autonomie, proactivité, engagé(e) et axé(e) sur les résultats   ;  Capacité à communiquer avec des équipes et des partenaires multidisciplinaires tout en décomposant des exigences complexes en sujets tangibles et pertinents   ;  Excellente maîtrise du français, autant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. 
 Atouts 
 Connaissance de Microsoft Visual Studio . 
 Ce que vous offre la GRICS 
 Un milieu de travail stimulant, humain et convivial   ;  La flexibilité de l’horaire (35 heures) et le télétravail en mode hybride   ;  Une équipe dynamique de spécialistes   ;  Quatre semaines de vacances annuelles, congés additionnels durant la période des fêtes   ;  D’excellentes conditions de travail incluant un régime de retraite à prestation déterminée   ;  Des défis et de la latitude professionnelle   ;  Et plus encore. 
 La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs importantes pour la GRICS, et nous encourageons toutes les personnes qualifiées à soumettre leur candidature.  Nous remercions toutes les candidates et tous les candidats de l’intérêt porté à la GRICS. Seules les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue  pour une entrevue  seront contactées.

Citi's mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. description.text:
Job Id: 23655861
Organization Overview:
Citi Market Operations Technology is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in people and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model and creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion.
We are a dynamic, global and diverse Organization, supporting operations areas that have a presence in over 60 Countries. Our Technology groups develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations groups which are core to the success of the Markets business and has significant impact across the lifecycle of a Trade by providing innovative products and solutions. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including product aligned Middle Office groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative & Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivatives, FXPB) where Citi has a significant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs. We play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a first-class experience in service performance and strategic partnership.
We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the firm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artificial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning.
Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the firm and our reputation.
We work closely with our external global peers, partners and regulators, and play an integral part in leading an agenda at the forefront to optimize and streamline processes and drive strategy across our industry.
Job Purpose:
Markets Operations Technology team is looking for a Lead Project Engineer with experience in developing High Volume Distributed Realtime Event Processing platforms. Person in this role will lead the development, and delivery of a critical initiative involving central data processing platform to house critical transactional data from multiple business processes and asset classes and make the data available over Enterprise Search Engines and Data Fabric.
This is a Vice President role within the ICG Markets Tech team. You will be the Lead Project Engineer responsible for the leadership and management of a diverse set of talent comprising of 20+ team members globally.This is a highly visible role for a key initiative wherein you would get opportunity to work on multiple asset classes and business functions, interact with many teams and stakeholders at senior levelThis is a great opportunity to join a high performing, high profile and energized team.You will be leading the development, and delivery of our central data processing platform to house critical transactional data from multiple business processes and asset classes. This is a critical firm wide initiative.You will also get the opportunity to liaise between key technology and business partners across Markets Operations and Tech, and liaise with the Citi Technology Teams which would include several SaaS offerings and Hardware teams and also interact with the Technology Experts of different Product Vendors. 
Responsibilities: 
Complete Ownership & Responsibility for end-to-end solution of Realtime High Volume Event Processing Platform.Work closely with business stakeholders and technology teams to drive execution and deliveryLead a culture of innovation & experimentation, support full software lifecycle that incorporates the best of technology approaches & delivery methodologiesManage team of professionals to accomplish established goals and conduct personnel duties for the teamActively participate in brainstorming session and provide solid inputs to the team and ensure best practices are followed within the team.Provide strategic influence and exercise control over resources, budget management and planning while monitoring end resultsValidate detailed requirements, working through solutions and managing execution and rollout of the platform. Responsible for the application meeting project specifications and client’s expectationsInfluence technical architecture and negotiate/communicate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties as necessaryProvide thought leadership on how to grow the platform.Hands-on Development opportunity across the latest niche technologies like ELK, Kafka, Mongo, MicroservicesContinuous Collaboration and co-ordination with teams spread across geography.Ensure Code quality and proper coverage is maintained, using tools like Secure Assist, Sonar etc.Ensure proper code governance using GIT/BitbucketDrive Infrastructure Assessment, Forecasting and Setup for the applications.
Qualification and Skills:

description.text:
Division : Operations Planning - Electricity 
Location : Vegreville, AB 
Position Summary:  
Always there. Anywhere. That’s us! We are committed to delivering inspired solutions for a better world. We care about our communities, we care about each other, and we care about showing up for those who need us. We never break a promise and we have the courage to do the right thing, even when it’s hard. We take pride in holding ourselves to the highest standard of integrity and excellence in all that we do. 
Come join an unconventional utility - one that will challenge you while you grow and develop. ATCO has some exciting projects underway such as Grid Modernization innovating how we manage our Distribution system, Decarbonization, Renewables, Solar Photovoltaics (PV), Battery Energy Storage System (BESS), Combined Heat & Power (CHP), Microgrids, and Electrification of transportation. We want you to help shape our energy future. Come be part of the change!
Are you a problem-solver who can think outside-the-box? Are you someone who can step back to look at the bigger picture? Someone who likes to interact with many different subject matter experts and facilitate discussions? Do you enjoy analyzing data and turning it into decision-making information for senior management? This opportunity will allow you to grow your leadership and communication skills, and allow you to make strategic, life-cycle decisions for ATCO Electric’s assets.
Reporting to the Supervising Engineer, Operations Planning this position is responsible for ATCO Electric’s Transmission and Distribution System Operations support function to ensure clear documentation, information and support for ATCO Operations enabling safe and reliable system performance and exceptional services to our customers. This area of responsibility will require technical skills in distribution and transmission power system analysis as well as understanding of system operations, interactions with the AESO and adjacent utilities and generators, risk mitigation and transmission and distribution protection.
Responsibilities:
Distribution Operations Planning
Support Distribution Operators requests for real time system management. Perform distribution power flow and coordination studies to assist in the development of switching steps/plans for 25 kV load transfers including model updates for load and Project additions, as necessary. Complete distribution analysis for load shed required for transmission risk assessments. Support Advanced Distribution Management Systems with ongoing advanced applications assisting integration through effective usage and comparison with CYME models. Ensure documentation of load transfer studies to incorporate into contingency manuals. Perform Customer causation outage analysis to assess linkage to transmission or distribution events. Ensure timely and accurate responses for Customer communications. Support new device training material for Operations working collaboratively with adjacent Engineering teams to document Operational information accurately prior to energization on the network. Work collaboratively with Regional Operation teams, Distribution & Facilities Planning teams, AESO and Operators
Transmission Operations Planning.
Support Transmission real time system management using contingency analysis tool and re-assessments of planned outage risk assessments for week ahead, day ahead preparedness. Perform transmission power flow and contingency analysis to provide transmission risk assessment and mitigation. Ensure compliance with AESO Rules for submissions and work with AESO and adjacent utilities. Perform book-end model assessment and modifications and contingency analysis for worst system conditions for seasonal operations studies and presentations for Operator preparedness training. Assist in wildfire assessments and Operational situational preparedness. Work collaboratively with adjacent System Operational Support personnel, Facilities Planning, AESO and Operators. 
Operations Planning Technical and Project Support
Support the updates of ATCO’s Operations Procedures, Joint Operating Agreements and Procedures and other Operational documentation. Support Projects documentation regarding lines, substations, and technical documentation. Provide Operational Planning Technical Support for all system and transmission capital maintenance projects including need for transmission line switches and ratings, voltage ranges to manage voltage stability and normal system operating limits, assistance with system control and anti-islanding requirements, etc. Support and assist Operational team in ensuring compliance to AESO and AUC rules. 
Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited University. Professional Engineering (P.Eng.) designation with APEGA is required. Two (2) to five (5) years of work experience as a P. Eng. preferably in an electrical utility environment. A solid understanding of power system concepts and a good understanding of power system analytical techniques as well as transmission/distribution equipment. Understanding of theory and philosophies behind different transmission and distribution protection schemes and coordination. Excellent reading comprehension, report writing, verbal communication and presentation skills. Adapt to change and focus on continuous improvement. Maintain an Alberta Class 5 driver’s license in good standing. Experience with modeling software such as CYME and PSS/E. Programming experience with Python is an asset. Ability to analyze system data to support Operational requirements as well as Customer Outage responses. Strong interpersonal and relationship development skills. Strong problem solving, decision making, and organization skills. 
What We Offer:  
A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, and striving for excellence  Competitive compensation  Flex benefits  Tuition assistance program  Training and mentorship programs  Charitable donation matching  
We would like to thank everyone for their application; however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. 
ATCO Electric is part of ATCO Ltd. With approximately 6,000 employees and assets of $23 billion, ATCO is a diversified global holding corporation with investments in Structures & Logistics (workforce housing, innovative modular facilities, construction, site support services, and logistics and operations management), Energy Infrastructure (electricity generation, transmission and distribution; natural gas transmission, distribution and infrastructure development; energy storage and industrial water solutions; and electricity and natural gas retail sales), Transportation (ports and transportation logistics) and Commercial Real Estate. More information can be found at www.ATCO.com. ATCO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.
Issued: June 8, 2023 
Expiry: June 22, 2023
This position is administered under the supervisory/professional salary administration guidelines.

description.text:
Job Description

What We Do

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

Who We Look For

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

We are a leading financial firm specializing in providing innovative solutions to our clients. We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our team. This role will focus on hands-on development experience for improving search and retrieval algorithms using language models. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of AI models, data processing pipelines, and conversational AI services.

ResponsibilitiesSearch and Retrieval Algorithm Development:Utilize your expertise in language models to improve search and retrieval algorithms.Conduct thorough experiments and evaluate different AI models for various use cases.Select and implement the most suitable AI models for improving search and retrieval performance.AI Model Development and Training:Build and train working versions of AI models using an AI platform.Leverage your knowledge of machine learning techniques to optimize and enhance the performance of the models.Collaborate with the data engineering team to ensure efficient data pipelines for model training.Reusable Patterns, Libraries, and Datasets:Identify and create reusable patterns, libraries, and datasets to improve efficiency and accelerate development.Contribute to the company's internal knowledge base by documenting best practices and sharing insights with the team.Conversational AI Services:Develop conversational AI services using large language models to enable interactions such as question answering and summarization.Ensure the services meet the required performance and accuracy standards.Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UX/UI designers, to deliver exceptional user experiences.Orchestration Tool Enhancement:Build and enhance orchestration tools to enable semantic search data ingestion pipelines.Implement document ingestion processes, vector embeddings for document digitization, and search and retrieval functionalities.Integrate conversational services into the orchestration tools to provide a seamless user experience.
About Goldman Sachs

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

companyDescription.text:
For 35 years, BCLC has been delivering exceptional entertainment to British Columbians by managing casino, lottery, bingo and sports betting. Thanks to our players, we’ve generated $25 billion for the Province of B.C. to support essential services such as healthcare, education and community programs. 

Our employees are in on the action too! Overall, BCLC staff spent more than 3,830 hours volunteering for local charities. Our employee-giving committees continue to organize events, silent auctions and draws to fundraise for important local causes selected by our people. 

We want everyone to enjoy gambling—and that means understanding how to play in a healthy way. We provide educational resources on how gambling works, and we help find support for those who need it.

description.text:
Overview

BCLC’s two offices are located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam Indian Band), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples in Vancouver and the Tk’emlúps te Secwépemc territory, situated within the Secwépemc Nation in Kamloops. We honour and respect the people, the territory, and the land we are part of.

Joining the Social Purpose & External Relations division at BCLC means you’ll be working with a dedicated group of talented professionals in Communications, Social Purpose and Community & Stakeholder Engagement, ESG, Public Affairs, Player Health, Customer Support Operations, Business Intelligence, Marketing, CRM and Loyalty. As a Crown Corporation that earns more than a billion dollars in annual profit, BCLC’s commitment to giving funds back to the province is an integral part of our business, but still only one piece of a bigger picture. BCLC is committed to creating a welcoming workplace where everyone feels safe, included, and valued. For us, that means building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We all are winners when differences are respected, valued and celebrated.

At BCLC, we exist to generate win-wins for the greater good. We believe everything we do must benefit the well-being of all involved. Through our Social Purpose, we aspire to make sure, in all of our endeavours, transactions and relationships – in the most important sense of life, livelihood, meaning, and well-being – nobody loses, and every person we touch comes out ahead.

Social Purpose is the driving force of our business, our opportunity to create a better world through innovation, engagement, and connection. BCLC aims to provide something unique that not only fills a need, but provides value to the province. Join the team responsible for telling our story, building stakeholder relationships, connecting with communities, and achieving our strategic vision for player-centered sustainable growth.

Job Summary

The Senior Analyst, Analytics Delivery develops, implements, maintains and supports business intelligence and reporting solutions to grow business intelligence capabilities. As an expert in business intelligence, is a consultative partner to both internal and external stakeholders, providing education, guidance and recommendations for improvement, and for bringing new concepts and methods to the analytic team. Acts as a mentor to other analysts in the adoption and implementation of the best practices in the data and reporting practice area.

Key Accountabilities
As an expert in BI, is a consultative partner to both internal and external stakeholders, providing education, guidance, and recommendations for improvement, and for bringing new concepts and methods to the Analytics team.Develops relevant processes, procedures, and standards within a BI tool environment in order to drive performance and program improvement.Closely collaborates with Client Insights and Analytics Execution teams to understand detailed BI needs and develop solutions that are supporting integrity of the reporting data; to provide feedback and sign off on requirements; and to analyze data, identify new insights and technical capabilities and provide verbal and/or written recommendations used by the Senior Client Insight Partners when compiling insights to be presented to the client.Develops data and or reporting functionality (reports, dashboards) based on requirements; designs, develops and executes queries to access and expose data layers to be used in providing business insights; supervises unit, integration and regression testing.Collaborates with Enterprise Data Warehouse team and other members of the BCLC’s Business Technology teams to support integrated data solutions.Maintains an oversight of the overall model suite to ensure consistency, accuracy and repeatability. Collaborates with Analytics Execution team in creating logical data model and based on it creates physical data models for new solution development in support of the business needs; Ensures data models are fully documented and appropriate data dictionaries are created.Performs user access management to newly developed reporting functionality and/or applications, or initiates and coordinates user access management with other BCLC technical teams.Performs technical maintenance and upgrades to applicable tools.Proactively stays informed of the new technologies or best practices in Business Intelligence and feeds this knowledge back to the team, EBI Director and Managers in order to influence department’s strategic initiatives; develops analytic capabilities through the socialization and dissemination of best-practices, and the creation and maintenance of data models for new solution development in support of the dynamic business needs.Coaches and provides training to the team on business intelligence methods, tools, design, and result, and on advanced reporting and database marketing best practices. Including segmentation, campaign management, core KPI development, and campaign level analysis.
Minimum Required Qualifications

Education and Experience
A degree in computer science, math, economics or business; 4-6 years of related experience in leading the development of business intelligence solutions and working in a BI environment (SAS, Qlikview, Cognos or equivalent tools) with working knowledge of SQL, MS Access, other Database Management tools;Solid expertise in the Business Intelligence processes with good understanding of BI architecture and data models;An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.
Technical Requirements
Proven experience in influencing and helping business stakeholders to frame their business problems and BI needs;Excellent understanding of analytical concepts and problem solving skills;Proven experience in gathering business requirements needed for successfully developing and supporting business intelligence applications;Experienced in data collection, data wrangling, data engineering data analysis and designing reporting solutions including but not limited to dashboards, portals, predictive models, machine learning algorithms and report objects;Excellent project management skills and ability to work on multiple priorities;Advanced oral and written communication skills; ability to develop technical documentation and explain complex information in an effective manner;Excellent interpersonal, time management, multi-tasking and organizational skills; able to act on own initiative, exercise sound judgment, prioritize tasks; and work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail;Have a solid BCLC business acumen and a knowledge of gaming industry and BCLC’s suite of games.
Additional Information
To build a rich diverse workforce representing the communities which we serve, we welcome applications from people of all colours and cultures, persons with diverse abilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community.BCLC values work life balance and offers remote work options for its employees.Relocation assistance is available for successful job candidates.If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance at any step of your application, please send an email with your request to recruitment@bclc.com.For over more than a decade, we have been recognized as one of BC’s Top Employers – and we are constantly seeking ways to improve our employee and player experience. To learn more about BCLC, please visit:https://corporate.bclc.com/careers/overview.html 
Please Note

This opportunity will remain open until a qualified candidate pool has been established.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada and be 19 years of age to work at BCLC.

description.text:
Description

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Data Engineer at TELUS, you’ll be in great company, working alongside some of the brightest and most creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Strategists. You will be part of the journey we’re on to better understand our customers, to predict their needs and interaction behavior.

Our team works in a fun, innovative, and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Marketing, Strategy & Data Insights team in our Home Solutions and Mobility business.

We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high-value and high-visibility projects. We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office. You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools.

This is a remote role with occasional visits to the office.

Roles & Responsibilities:

You will demonstrate sound engineering principles and a good understanding of modern CI/CD toolsetsDesign and build data extraction, loading and transformation pipelines and data products across on-prem and cloud platformsPerform application impact assessments, requirements reviews and develop work estimatesDevelop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products & solutionsLead resolution of critical operations issues including post-implementation reviewsPerform technical data stewardship tasks including metadata management, security and privacy by designBeing action-oriented, ensuring accountability, driving results, being collaborative and communicating effectively, will be essentialResearch, construct, develop, and test complex ETL pipelineApply automation and monitoring tools using a test-driven approach and mindsetDevelop and maintain scalable data infrastructure that provides an outstanding experience for internal stakeholders and enables consistent value extraction from dataInnovate data ingestion and processing methods to support strategic priorities and facilitate decision-making throughout the organizationBuild and scale data infrastructure that powers batch and real-time data processing of thousands of records dailyInterface with data scientists, analysts, product managers and all data stakeholders to understand their needs and promote best practicesArchitect data pipelines that provide fast, optimized, and robust end-to-end solutionsDrive and maintain a culture of quality, innovation and experimentation

Qualifications 6+ years Data Engineering experience4 years data platform solution architecture and designYou are a collaborative, creative, open-minded individual who possesses a natural curiosity and desire to experimentProficiency in:Programming language experience (java/python - including low code tools such as Informatica, Datastage or equivalent)SQL and database proficiency (min 3 years)Task automation - setting up DAGS in Control-M, Apache Airflow, Prefect, etcUnix scriptingQuality Assurance & Site Reliability EngineeringInfrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, Pulumi, Puppet, Ansible)Data ModelingWorking Knowledge of ML Ops


Education and Professional Designation / Certification

Bachelor's Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related fieldData engineering certificationGCP certificationAnalytics - BI or AI/ML
